t: The*p word that Jeremiah the prophet spake unto Baruch the son of Neriah, when he had written these words in a book at the mouth of Jeremiah, in the fourth year of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah king of Judah, saying,
Thus*p saith the Lord,*s the God of Israel, unto thee, O Baruch;
Thou*p didst say, Woe is me now! for the Lord*s hath added grief to my sorrow; I fainted in my sighing, and I find no rest.
Thus*p shalt thou say unto him, The Lord*s saith thus; Behold, that which I have built will I break down, and that which I have planted I will pluck up, even this whole land.

And*p seekest thou great things for thyself? seek them not: for, behold, I will bring evil upon all flesh, saith the Lord:*s but thy life will I give unto thee for a prey in all places whither thou goest.
